member.name: M:SudokuStudio.Interaction.GridUpdatedEventArgs.#ctor(SudokuStudio.Interaction.GridUpdatedBehavior,System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes a instance via the specified data.
member.param: The behavior that describes which kind of behavior is applied to replacing a grid with the new value.

summary.para: Indicates the new value to be replaced.

The type of the value is because the internal type will be varied from different value of property . The target type is:
Value of property Target type of this property
An value indicating the candidate eliminated.
An value indicating the candidates eliminated, by >> 9 to get the target cell, and & 511 to get digits eliminated.
An value indicating the candidate set.
An value indicating the cell to be set empty.
A value indicating the newer grid to be replaced with the original one.
A value indicating the newer grid to be replaced with the original one.
A value indicating the newer grid to be replaced with the original one.
You can use pattern matching to check the internal type such as NewValue is int targetValue, or just use type casting: (int)NewValue if you know what the behavior is currently.

member.name: T:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.MonitorDpiType
member.summary: Identifies the dots per inch (dpi) setting for a monitor.

remarks.para: All of these settings are affected by the PROCESS_DPI_AWARENESS of your application.
Source: MONITOR_DPI_TYPE enumeration (shellscalingapi.h).

summary.para: Value: 0
The effective DPI. This value should be used when determining the correct scale factor for scaling UI elements. This incorporates the scale factor set by the user for this specific display.
Value: 1
The angular DPI. This DPI ensures rendering at a compliant angular resolution on the screen. This does not include the scale factor set by the user for this specific display.
Value: 2

The raw DPI. This value is the linear DPI of the screen as measured on the screen itself. Use this value when you want to read the pixel density and not the recommended scaling setting. This does not include the scale factor set by the user for this specific display and is not guaranteed to be a supported DPI value.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Prevent conflicting inputs.

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Strings.Resources.SettingsPage_PreventConflictingInputDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to This option limits the case that user wants to input a digit into a cell, whose containing houses has already include the digit as given or modifiable values. If this option is set true, the program won't allow this case, and do nothing after you input a wrong digit..

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Strings.Resources.SettingsPage_ReverseBugMaxSearchingEmptyCellsCountDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to A value controlling the complexity of searching operation for Reverse BUG technique. This maximum possible value is 4, recommend value is 2, and the minimum value is 1. It cannot be negative..

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Strings.Resources.SettingsPage_StepSearcherOrderingDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to This option controls the ordering of step-searching. For example, if you put "Subsets" before "Locked Candidates", subset-related steps will have a higher priority to be searched. If you disable it, it will be really disabled in step-searching. In addition, we recommend you NOT disable or re-order some important step searchers such as "Singles"..

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Strings.Resources.SettingsPage_StrongLinkDashStyle
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Strong link dash style.

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Strings.Resources.SettingsPage_StrongLinkDashStyleDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Please input a series of digits, indicating the dash style of a chain link. Digits are the length of all split sub-lines. For example, "3,2" means a dotted line with contain several periods of two sub-lines, with lengths 3 and 2. You can keep the text box be empty, which means the line will not use dotted rule to separate it with multiple parts..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Make sudoku pane background transparent.

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Strings.Resources.SettingsPage_TransparentBackgroundDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to If this option is true, white background of sudoku pane will not be rendered. This will make the sudoku pane a better look. Please note that saving/copying transparent-background sudoku pane is terrible, so this program offers a rescue that prevents "Empty background" bug, but it may cause a flashing while saving/copying pictures from sudoku pane..

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Strings.Resources.SingleCountingPracticingPage_Intro
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to This page offers you a sudoku grid to practice techniques "Naked Single" and "Full House". You can get experienced from this page. The puzzle will generate some puzzles and display them one by one, you should input the result inside the sudoku pane. No matter whether your answer is correct, program will go to the next puzzle. When you answer the specified number of puzzles, the game will be automatically over, and calculates the result..

member.remarks:
Pattern explanation:
○ Match the string "IsEnabled".
○ Match a whitespace character atomically any number of times.
○ Match '='.
○ Match a whitespace character atomically any number of times.
○ 1st capture group.
○ Match with 2 alternative expressions.
○ Match a sequence of expressions.
○ Match a character in the set [Tt].
○ Match the string "rue".
○ Match a sequence of expressions.
○ Match a character in the set [Ff].
○ Match the string "alse".
○ Match ','.
○ Match a whitespace character atomically any number of times.
○ Match the string "Name".
○ Match a whitespace character atomically any number of times.
○ Match '='.
○ Match a whitespace character greedily any number of times.
○ 2nd capture group.
○ Match a character other than ',' atomically at least once.
○ Match ','.
○ Match a whitespace character atomically any number of times.
○ Match the string "TypeName".
○ Match a whitespace character atomically any number of times.
○ Match '='.
○ Match a whitespace character atomically any number of times.
○ 3rd capture group.
○ Match a word character atomically at least once.

member.summary: Indicates whether the pane prevent the simple confliction, which means, if you input a digit that is conflict with the digits in its containing houses, this pane will do nothing by this value being . summary.para: Indicates the previously selected candidate.

This field can record the previous data in a pair of clicking operation. For example, constructing a chain, we should click twice, for the head and tail of the chain. If we click at the second time, this field will be set the candidate having clicked at the first time.

remarks.para: Due to the design of members in s, we cannot use this type as a type argument, because APIs may not contain any implementation from this type, so C# compiler cannot determine which method can be called. Therefore, here we cannot use generic type to pass arguments because here the type contains members.

This topic relates to the content in the following links:
Proposal - "Interfaces as type arguments" part
Discussion page about this
In short, that's why I use instead of as the type of the argument .
